result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota Z. Vetter

Jury status hearing on January 27, 2023 at 09:20 am.
Jury Trial on February 14, 2023 at 08:30 am.

$5,000 signature bond with the first $1,000 cash. No contact with victim(s):  K.S.S.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. Defendant is not allowed to leave the County of Marathon during the pendency of the case.

Case Called: 8:57 am

State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Adam Fontana in person.
VRCW.

Atty Fontana makes arguments. 
State objects to any bond modification and makes arguments.

Court addresses the parties and makes findings;
COURT ORDERS:
Amends Bond to a $5,000 Signature Bond with the First $1,000 Cash- Same Conditions with the additional condition of "Defendant is not allowed to leave the County of Marathon during the pendency of the case"
